opener.salute: My Dear Co-WorkersCo-workers, Friends, and Clubwomen:-

div.p:
My heart is made to feel glad as I send out to you this message of
Faithfaith and Good Worksgood works. Thank God, that you have all stood by me, during these
six years and you have said, "She shall not fail.".

The Douglass Home, Our Homeour home, has been redeemed, is now being restored,
and will be dedicated August 12, 1922. With you being present to help show to
the world that the Colored Womencolored women of America stand united, and my dear women uni
ted, we can do whatever we wish. With a united womanhood, we can and will stamp
out Lynchinglynching, Mobmob violence, Jim Crow Carscars, and Segregationsegregation, and we can and will
stand for a better, higher American Citizenshipcitizenship of which we are a big factor and
play an important part. Not only the home, but the grounds are being graded,
replanted with cedar trees, new steps and cement drain, new cement walks, rose
beds and others, just like Mr. Douglass has when he lived there. You and I are
going to catch the inspiration as we go from room to room, and as we wander
over the lawn and through the forest. Yes, we will pledge ourselves anew to the
principles for which Douglass lived.

Three memorial tablets will be erected and unveiled August 12th,
one in honor of the late Madam C. J. Walker, who gave the largest amount to
redeem the home, and two in honor of the loyal men and women and organizations
who gave $25.00 and upwards to help in the restoration and redemption of this
spot. Another statue of Douglass will also be unveiled at that time. Neither
do we forget the loyal men and women and clubs who gave as largely as they
could, even the mite helped us to accomplish the work.

Now that we own this wonderful "Inspiration Point,", we must keep
it always as beautiful as Mt. Vernon. To do this, a law was passed in Denver,
"That Every Club Womanthat every clubwoman must give 5¢ per year for the upkeep of the home.". This
means that every Club Womanclubwoman owes 10¢ biennially to Mrs. N. L. Napier our Custodiancus
todian of funds, as her part in the keeping up of our home. Let us not stop
with club womenclubwomen, let every Coloredcolored woman in AmericanAmerica give 5¢ per year for this,
it will not be a heavy tax and you will feel a pride in so doing. This
belongs to you. Send your tax to Mrs. Napier direct before May 30th.

p.emph: Do not send to your state president!

div.p:
Send direct to Mrs. Napier and she will send you receipt upon re
turn mail, this receipt your delegate must show to the Credential Committee in
Richmond to be seated at the Convention.

One thousand medals will be struck off in honor of this dedication
and these can be bought by any woman who has paid her 5¢ per capita. We will
sell them at cost, which will probably be 25¢ each. Orders filled as rapidly
as money is sent, none will be sent without cash. Mrs. Napier will handle the
medals.

Remember to celebrate Douglass Day every year February 14th, just
as religiously as you have been taught to celebrate Washinton's birthday and
Lincoln's birthday.

Twenty thousand (20,000) letters have been sent out during these
six years. The work has been tremendous but I am glad that we did not fail.
If any mistake has been made in the name on tablet, send corrections direct to
me. April 10th is the last date Sculptorsculptor Ellerhusen will receive names.

Do you know any name that should be there? If so, send $25.00 to
Mrs. Napier and she will see that the name is placed.

This tablet represents Colored America's thoughtfull men and women
with true race pride. Their children can point to the names of their parents
inscribed there as proudly as do the Anglo SaxonsAnglo-Saxons to the signatures of the
Declaration of Independence.

The Bronzebronze Tabletstablets in addition to the names will picture the princi
pal scenes in the life of Douglass, forever telling to the world what was done
by this man whose life we will ever strike to emulate.

With deep thanks for your loyalty to me and with a grateful heart,
I remain
